topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1 Beta: Step 3 -Deploying the Lifecycle Manager in a Denver Deployment

body.p: The first phase of the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation involves creating a bootstrapping the lifecycle manager VM and installation services.
The installation uses Ansible playbooks, which are files that contain scripts that execute required installation processes.

section.title: Prepare the system for deployment
section.p: Use the following steps to prepare the server on which the lifecycle manager will be deployed (the lifecycle manager host):

ol.li: Log into the lifecycle manager host using the default credentials

Edit the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file for your environment. For information on each variable, refer to the comments in the file with each variable.
Set the ovs_cloud_only variable to 3;
Set the cloud_type variable to 'av';
Set the CLM IP network details for to your network setup;
Set the Cobbler IP addresses according to your network setup;
The group_vars/all file should appear similar to the following:---
############################################# Variables for HLM ################################################################# #These variables are relevant in both All Virtual and BareMetal scenarios.
#Set this to '0' for dcn cloud, '1' for ovs cloud, '2' for denver or denver_virtual cloud. ovs_cloud_only: 3
#Set this to 'bm' if cloud is being deployed over baremetal. #Set this to 'av' if the cloud is all virtual cloud_type: 'av'
#These are hlm related variables that must be changed according to your Baremetal Env hlm_login_id: root hlm_password: cghelion
#The following variables are for CLM network IP details for HLM hlm_clmstaticip: 10.10.2.100 hlm_clmnetmask: 255.255.255.0 hlm_clmgateway: 10.10.2.1
#The variables starting with cobbler_ are inputs that are usually given to initcobbler.sh. Set accordingly. cobbler_pxestartip: 10.10.1.100 cobbler_pxeendip: 10.10.1.200 cobbler_pxestaticip: 10.10.1.7 cobbler_pxenetmask: 255.255.255.0 cobbler_hlinux_password: ohcanada cobbler_web_password: cobbler
#Set the location of your images that will be used by libvirt imagelocation: /var/lib/libvirt/images
#Set the location of your infra-ansible-playbooks ansible_dir: ~/infra-ansible-playbooks
##################################################################################################################################
############################################# Variables for DCN ################################################################## #Set the location of dcn bits on KVM #There must be 4 debs, 2 tar.gz files, 1 vsc qcow2 #You must copy your VSD qcow2 to the imagelocation on the KVM if you want to provision it on the same KVM as the HLM dcn_dir: ~/cg/dcn ##################################################################################################################################
############################################# Variables for VSD ################################################################## #Ignore these variables if creating an OVS cloud. This section is relevant only for DCN cloud - in both BM and All Virtual cases #These variables are used for VSD Configuration #If you have already configured a VSD and ignore the following variables
dns_domain_name: helion.cg dns_address: 10.10.10.25 vsd_address: 10.10.10.10 vsd_gateway: 10.10.10.1 vsd_netmask: 255.255.255.0 vsd_name: vsd vsdimagename: VSD-3.0.0_HP_r3.0_36 upstream_ntp_servers: - 10.10.10.25 - 10.1.64.20 ###################################################################################################################################
Edit the group_vars/all-kvm-net file to make sure the VLAN tag IDs are correct according to your network configuration.

bodydiv.section:
Increase the hard disk size (optional)You can increase the hard disk size for the controllers. By default, each controller is assigned 80 GB.
Edit the group_vars/all-virtual file to set the disk and RAM size, as needed.
vm_ctrl_ram: vm_ctrl_disksize:
Change to the following directory:cd ~/infra-ansible-playbooks/roles/SETUP-CLOUD-ON-AV/tasks/
Edit the rcp_controller.yml file to change the +80G value in the QCOW2 line for all controllers:qemu-img create -f qcow2 -o preallocation=metdata ((imagelocation)) /ccn1.qcow2 +80G

section.title: Deploy the Lifecycle Manager Virtual Machine
section.p: Use the following steps on the lifecycle manager host to deploy the lifecycle manager on that host using Ansible playbooks.

ol.li: Change to infra-ansible-playbooks directory ~/ cd infra-ansible-playbooks
If you want to use the HCG Dashboard to perform the installation, edit the setup_vcloud.yml file to comment out SETUP-CLOUD-ON-AV role.

Execute the following command to create required Ansible roles. These roles create the lifecycle manager, the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade controllers and configure the lifecycle manager.ansible-playbook -i hosts setup_rcpcloud.yml
The setup_rcpcloud.yml file contains 3 Ansible roles: SETUP-INFRA-ON-AV, SETUP-CLOUD-ON-AV, HLM-CFG. These roles creates lifecycle manager VM, install the HP Helion OpenStack controllers and configure the lifecycle manager VM. Sample Ansible Playbook run output
Note: If you receive the following error during the Ansible deployment: Failed to fetch http://hlinux-deejay.us.rdlabs.hpecorp.net/hLinux/dists/cattleprod/InRelease Unable to find expected entry 'main/binary-i386/Packages' in Release file (Wrong sources.list entry or malformed file) Some index files failed to download. They have been ignored, or old ones used instead.Run the following command:dpkg --remove-architecture i386
